react4j.core

Class ReactConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • react4j.core.ReactConfig

  • public final class ReactConfig
extends Object
    Location of all compile time configuration settings for framework.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean checkComponentStateInvariants()
      Return true if we should check that the user interacts with React component in a way compatible with the state.
      static boolean enableComponentNames()
      Return true if components should have human readable names specified.
      static boolean isProductionMode()
      Return true if in production mode.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • isProductionMode

        public static boolean isProductionMode()
        Return true if in production mode. Production mode sets the default values for other compile time constants to the variant that assumes your code is correct and does not generate additional assert or debug statements. The individual configuration settings can still be specified to override this value.
        Returns:
        true if in production mode.

      • enableComponentNames

        public static boolean enableComponentNames()
        Return true if components should have human readable names specified. Useful if you want to interact via DevTools or other tool chains.
        Returns:
        to enable human readable names for components.

      • checkComponentStateInvariants

        public static boolean checkComponentStateInvariants()
        Return true if we should check that the user interacts with React component in a way compatible with the state. i.e. setInitialState should only be invoked at the start, setState should not be invoked while render is running etc.
        Returns:
        true to enable invariant checking about how we interact with native react component.
